conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it is directed into the containers.
Image 1 shows the initial positions of the liquids (A, B, C, and D) and the containers (E, F, and G).
Image 2 shows the liquids after passing through the baffles, with colors mixed and some changed direction.
Image 3 shows the final positions of the liquids after they have flowed into the containers.
Liquid A is directed towards the right side in Image 2 and is in container G in Image 3.
Liquid B is directed towards the left side in Image 2 and is in container E in Image 3.
Liquid C is directed towards the right side in Image 2 and is in container G in Image 3.
Liquid D is directed towards the left side in Image 2 and is in container F in Image 3.
Liquid A flows into container G.
Liquid B flows into container E.
Liquid C flows into container G.
Liquid D flows into container F.
